Pop Film: Zombies!!!
by Matt Jacobs
With Dylan Dog: Dead of Night hitting the theatres this week featuring a tattooed Super Zombie
column2:
does the world really need another Zombie story?



The answer to this question for any zombie fan is an obvious YES! But for those who are not into the whole zombie-thing are probably scratching their heads asking why?

The answer is easy and hopefully this will help non-zombie goers understand our fascination with Zombies.

One of the worst possible disasters would have to be a Zombie Apocalypse. Even beyond an alien invasion as seen in Skyline or Battle LA. A zombie apocalypse is the only disaster that turns those you love and count on, against you. It&rsquo
column3:
s the only disaster that opens the possibility of you being eaten alive by the people you care about. What is more horrible and heart wrenching than that?

Though being eaten alive is just the start, that doesn&rsquo
column4: t include all the other  bad stuff that comes with an Apocalypse. Shortage of supplies, no safe  place to run, crazy nomads and no hope. It brings out the absolute worst  in mankind, every man for himself. Not to mention, unless it is caused  by something divine, it&rsquo
column5:
s one of the only disasters that we as humans cause. Military testing out a new weapon or nuclear meltdown mutates people into flesh eating monsters. Either way, it is a reflection on society, and where some people speculate we are headed as a self destructive civilization.

When you watch a zombie movie or read a story, if you can get beyond the whole &lsquo
column8: re left with is a sense of  fear that doesn&rsquo
column9:
t exist in any other genre. Tell me, how would you react if your spouse or kid started running after you trying to eat your brains? You have two choices, kill the one you love or join them in the undead. Either way you lose. Or maybe you fend yourself off and kill your way out, but in the process you got a small bite. Well, you lose again.

So it&rsquo
column10: s not the gore or superficial horror of zombie stories that drive  people&rsquo
column11: s obsession with the genre. Even the worst cheesy zombie movies  stir a question deep inside and pose the question, &ldquo
column12: How long would I  survive in a Zombie Apocalypse.&rdquo
column13:
Now ask yourself, how well are you prepared?

If you&rsquo
column16: ve included a list of a few  upcoming Zombie movies that you should check out to get you prepared.  &nbsp
column18:
ve also listed my top 5 of all time and a couple that zombie fans should check out.

2011 looks to be the year of Zombies! Let&rsquo
column20: t see emo  zombies in a Twilight: Team Undead movie where they will sparkle before  they eat you. Zombie fan or not, prepare yourself for the undead as they  horde the movie theatres and shelves. Here are a few that I&rsquo
column21:
m looking forward too.


Upcoming Zombie Flicks
Pride and Prejudice and Zombies - Natalie Portman will produce and star in this mixture of Jane Austen and Zombies. Should be interesting.

Zombieland 2 - If you haven&rsquo
column22: t seen the first one, do yourself a favor and watch it.  When it comes to rules of surviving the Apocalypse, this one has some  great points. Not to mention it&rsquo
column23:
s funny and we get Bill Murray as a zombie.

28 Months Later - Quite possibly my favorite zombie series and will tackle the issue of the virus getting out of the UK. Let&rsquo
column24:
s just hope if an Apocalypse did happen, we want the moaning, shuffling zombies, not the ones shown in this series. Scary!

The Riot - Ron Perlman is starring in this one which starts with a group of people trying to survive a riot and come to find out they have to worry about the undead too! Sounds like this could be a good one.

Dead Season - This indy zombie movie focuses on the idea of survival, and how the zombies will bring out the best and the worst in all of us.
http://www.deadseasonmovie.com/ has more info. Here is a trailer.

column1: Dead Season Trailer 1 from enzosauce on Vimeo.

For a full list this site is a great resource:
http://www.zombiezonenews.com/zombie-movies-list/upcoming-zombie-movie-list/


My Top 5
1) 28 Days Later - Heart pounding, adrenaline fueled, this series changed the way Zombies were portrayed. Again if there was going to be an Apocalypse, you better hope it&rsquo
column2: s not these kinds of zombies.

column3:
/>

2) Shaun of the Dead - While this movie isn&rsquo
column5: s a great place to start for  people who aren&rsquo
column6: t into the whole zombie thing. It&rsquo
column7: s funny as hell and pokes some fun at the genre.

column3:
/>

3) Zombieland - Again, not really scary, but solid through and through. Another great choice for people on the fence about zombie movies.
column6:
/>

4) Dawn of the Dead (Remake) - The opening sequence of the film with the zombie outbreak is quite possibly one of the best opens I&rsquo
column7: ve ever seen. This opening, above all  the zombie films, makes you ask, &ldquo
column11:
/>

5) The Walking Dead - Now this might not be a movie, but this series adapted from the popular comic series is really well done. From effects to character development, this series packs it all in. If nothing else, it opened up the genre to a wider audience and might be responsible for the wave of zombie stories hitting the mainstream this year.
column13:
/>

Honorable Mentions
Dead Set - Somehow I missed this until recently, but this series from the UK combines the Zombie Apocalypse with Big Brother. Now that might sound like it could be humorous, but this is not for the faint of heart.
column15:
/>

PontyPool - This film takes a very interesting stance on the zombie genre. Infection is spread through language and much of the &lsquo
column17: takes place through sound. Very interesting with great acting. Though not as action packed as some fans might want.

159,"0","The Frame Rate: Adult Swim's Flagship Show Gets Reboot","Adult Swim's Flagship Show Gets Reboot","","",,"

The Frame Rate: Adult Swim's Flagship Show Gets Reboot
by Crix Lee

Adult Swim's Flagship Show Gets Reboot

But was it really necessary?
column2: On September 2, 2001, Cartoon Network launched their late night, adult-oriented cartoon block and named it [adult swim].
column4: AS fills our eyeholes with original programming (Metalocalypse,&nbsp
column5: Robot Chicken, Venture Brothers, The Boondocks), syndicated shows (Family Guy, American Dad, King of the Hill) and Saturday night anime blocks (Bleach and Fullmetal Alchemist).&nbsp
column6: But now something is on the horizon and I'm not sure if I really want to see it happen&hellip
column7: AS' flagship show, Aqua Teen Hunger Force (ATHF), is getting a reboot.&nbsp
column8:
The longest running original series on Adult Swim, ATHF originally premiered before Adult Swim existed. Back in December of 2000, AS was a small block of shows dubbed the ""Williams Street"" block (with Sealab 2021, The Brak Show, Harvey Birdman: Attorney at Law) before officially becoming the nine hour block we know today.

In ATHF, we follow the exploits of three living, breathing, TALKING fast food characters: Master Shake, Frylock, and Meatwad, who live in the suburbs of New Jersey. Originally, the show started out with these three fighting crime and solving mysteries but after three episodes, that idea was chucked and with the addition of their neighbor, Carl (who has a love/hate for them) the show turned into more of a very, very, surreal version of Seinfeld.
column9: Sight gags galore, goofy plotlines, aliens and the joys of getting a job have all been explored for the last 10 years and 100 episodes.&nbsp
column10: Along with an all-star roster of guest stars (including Zakk Wilde, Glenn Danzig, David Cross, Bill Hader, Scott Adsit, and Fred Armisen)
column11:
this show went from a show I didn't understand in the beginning (and HATED) to a show that I LOVE and will punch anyone in the face that says differently.

(Not really, but I WILL try to ""box set bully"" you into liking it! haha)

I come from the ""If it ain't broke, don't fix it"" school of thought and get VERY nervous when beloved shows decide to futz around with their storyline and characters
column12: because it usually leads to it being its LAST SEASON. Like when Fonzie jumped the shark (Happy Days) or Cousin Oliver coming to live with The Brady Bunch.&nbsp
column14:
and I am afraid because from what I'm seeing and hearing so far, I do not heart.

Now renamed ""Aqua Unit Patrol Squad 1"", we find the team going back to their roots and solving crimes - in Seattle.
column16:
followed by ""What about Carl? Better find a way to bring him, too, or this new show is toast.""

I AM relieved to know that George Lowe (best known to AS fans from ""Space Ghost Coast to Coast"") will appear in every episode of the new season and reoccurring show openers Dr Weird
column17:
(""Gentlemen, BEHOLD!"") and Steve will be returning as well. But there's a nagging question that goes with that: as Dr Weird's lab is located on the ""South Jersey Shore"", does this mean they'll be getting new digs on one of the islands near Seattle?

In my experience, sometimes changing the theme to a show can help or hurt it.
column18: This season of U.S. of Tara (Showtime) has decided to get rid of their show's opening sequence and theme song altogether and in some ways, it kind of lost some of the magic that went with it, BUT when The Drew Carey Show changed theirs from an animated version of Drew singing the whimsical ""Moon Over Parma"" (which was MY fave) to Drew and fellow castrates lip-synching ""Cleveland Rocks"" (where the show was set) with a montage of the city and people of Cleveland
column19:
the ratings skyrocketed.

When I think ATHF, I think of Schoolly D's BRILLIANT opening theme:

column1: Awesome, right? Well, wave ""bye bye"" to that theme because the opening AND the theme song have been retooled as well.
column2:
And while the new theme is written and performed by Queens Of The Stone Age front man Joshua Homme and longtime collaborator Alain Johannes (and will probably be rocking), I DO NOT HEART the change.

Here's the official press release from Meatwad (with a little help from producer Dave Willis)

column1:
I'll be watching with reservations but also with an open mind, because it could all be a clever ruse. Here's hoping.

The Frame Rate: Please don't let this be the TV equivalent of ""New Coke"".
New season premieres Sunday, May 8th on [adult swim]

Pop Film: THOR
by Andy Dugan

<param name=""wmode"" value=""transparent"" /><embed type=""application/x-shockwave-flash"" width=""520"" height=""245"" src=""http://www.paramount.com/webmaster/player/paramount_epk.php"" flashvars=""cid=fc27f3e4fdb1f1ce2bf331dee214280cb0bd3bdb"" wmode=""transparent"" allowfullscreen=""true""></embed>

Thanks to the people at Paramount, I got to see an early screening of THOR. I honestly expected THOR to be a great film... the casting, the director, the studio, all of the things involved in making THOR into a movie, added up to be a great film from my perspective. It was a great movie. There is really only 2 ways to go with THOR, either you make it really bad, or you make it great. Marvel hit another home run with this one. THOR IS A GOD. That's it. Don't make excuses, just accept that he's a god, and he's awesome.
Chris Hemsworth captured the character of THOR and delivers a great performance. It could be argued, that playing THOR could be harder than SUPERMAN, considering you are portraying a god.

The premise couldn't have been easy to navigate for anyone involved in production. Somehow, you have to know THOR as The God Of Thunder, but you also have to get him to Earth, and make him Donald Blake... and set up next year's THE AVENGERS. This was all done to perfection.

<param name=""wmode"" value=""transparent"" /><embed type=""application/x-shockwave-flash"" width=""520"" height=""246"" src=""http://www.paramount.com/webmaster/player/paramount_epk.php"" flashvars=""cid=bf5ade7c87246bf75944de81a13e9a539c03791f"" wmode=""transparent"" allowfullscreen=""true""></embed>

All I can do is highly endorse THOR. I think it's worth the price of a 2D movie ticket, possibly numerous times. I can't endorse the 3D though, it doesn't help, or hurt the film. This is a movie that needs no 3D, it only needs the might power of Mjolnir!

Learn more about THOR with Jason Badower's BULLET POINTS: THOR also on Pop Galaxy!

Pop Games: Chicks vs Kittens
by Crix Lee

Kittens are EVIL...in this game, at any rate.



Now roosting in the iPhone app store is a new arcade style game, &lsquo
column3:
.

In CvK, you're a mother bird defending your nest against the relentless hoards of kittens intent on catching YOU and your only defense is to hatch a variety of chicks that will do anything to keep you alive.

Using your defenses such as Rotten Eggs, Ninja Attacks, Sonic Squawks, Super Chicks, Throwing Chicks and even Fish, your goal as mother bird is to survive the day until the terrible kittens finally give up the chase.

Game includes:



60 FUN LEVELS
Try and survive the day from dawn till dusk, with 60 levels spread over three increasingly challenging worlds.

GAMECENTER LEADERBOARDS
Be the best and use all of your cunning tricks to challenge your friends and reach the top of the leaderboards.



FUN ARCADE &
column4:
STRATEGY ACTION
Use your skill to lay eggs, assign chicks and collect your resources. Use your intelligence to plan your actions and make the best use of your available arsenal.



EASY TO PLAY... A CHALLENGE TO MASTER
It&rsquo
column5: s simple to pick up and play, but once you scratch the surface there&rsquo
column6:
s more and more to this game for you to discover. Getting through the levels is one thing, but getting the best score is a real challenge!



FUNKY CHICKS &
column7:
CRAZY KITTENS
There are lots of different types of chicks available, along with various kinds of kittens. Not to mention the special abilities your mother bird has, such as Sonic Attacks, Rotten Eggs and Double Yolks. Defend her against the increasingly cunning kittens, who get ever wiser as well as seeking help from hideous Hawks and &lsquo
column8:
orrible Owls!

Check out the trailer!


Chicks vs Kittens is now available in the app store for .99 cents.

For more info, you can hit up Game Digits' official website
column11:
(It kinda looks like Angry Birds meets Plants vs Zombies but for .99 cents...could be fun!)

column9: >Gifted and cocky test  pilot, Hal Jordan is chosen by a dying alien, Abin Sur to take over his  mantle as a member of the Green Lantern Corp. Abin Sur gives Hal his  power ring &ndash
column10: a device capable of creating anything Hal can imagine. &nbsp
column11: Hal  discovers that the Green Lantern Corps are made up of hundreds of alien  races banding together as the universe&rsquo
column12: s protectors of peace and justice.
column20: >When a new foe called Parallax threatens the universe, Hal along with the encouragement of fellow pilot and childhood sweetheart, Carl Ferris must master the ring and his courage to save the universe.
column28: >Directed by Martin  Campbell (Casino Royale) and starring Ryan Reynolds &amp
column45: >Hal Jordan is a normal, physically fit, human test pilot. When Hal wields the Green Lantern ring, (one of the most powerful weapons in the universe), he is the greatest Green Lantern of them all, with an unmatched level of will, courage and humanity.
column53: >Using the ring, Hal can create solid light objects of anything he can imagine. The most commonly used powers includes a forcefield that allows protection from physical and mental attacks as well as the vacuum of space. He can fly and is also capable of interstellar flight. Offensively he can create energy blasts or objects of solid light to attack with. The ring can also translate any language and allows communication between fellow Corps members.

165,"0","The Frame Rate: ""Coraline"" Team Reunites To Make ""ParaNorman""","The Frame Rate: ""Coraline"" Team Reunites To Make ""ParaNorman""","","",,"

The Frame Rate: ""Coraline"" Team Reunites To Make ""ParaNorman""
by Crix Lee

On May 4th, Focus Features and LAIKA, the team that gave us the 2009 Academy Award-nominated film ""Coraline"", announced they're teaming up again for a two-picture deal - the first being ""ParaNorman"".

&ldquo
column2: ParaNorman is a story of intense beauty and emotional truth. It&rsquo
column3: s audacious, has genuine heart, and is funny as hell. We&rsquo
column4: re incredibly excited to share this wonderful story with the world.&nbsp
column6: re privileged to work again with Focus Features, with whom we share a commitment to bold, distinctive, and enduring films.&nbsp
column7: LAIKA and Focus are truly kindred spirits.&nbsp
column8: James Schamus and his extraordinary team have built their reputation on original thinking, old-fashioned muscle, and an unerring fidelity to creatively rich and thematically challenging cinema.&nbsp
column10: re thrilled to extend the relationship that began with Coraline and look forward to being a part of the Focus/Universal family for years to come.&rdquo
column11: - LAIKA President and CEO Travis Knight

column1:
Only the second stop-motion animated feature to be made in 3D (Coraline was the first), ParaNorman is billed as a comedic thriller about a small town that becomes overrun with zombies and the only person in town who can speak to the dead is a young, misunderstood lad named Norman. Not only does Norman have to deal with the town's zombie problem, he also has to face ghosts, witches, and (of course) idiot grown-ups in order to save his town from a centuries-old curse and while up to the challenge - Norman finds his abilities stretched to the absolute limit.



With Kodi Smit-McPhee (The Road, Let Me In) as the voice of Norman, the cast includes Oscar nominees and a Broadway LEGEND. With Casey Affleck (Good Will Hunting)
column3: Jeff Garlin (Curb Your Enthusiasm, Toy Story 3)
column8:
Christopher Mintz-Plasse (Superbad, How To Train Your Dragon) and MY personal heroine (known as one of the Grand Dames of Broadway) Elaine Stritch (30 Rock) - this movie shows great promise of being something wonderfully creepy!

Currently in production, ParaNorman is written by Chris Butler (storyboard supervisor for Coraline/storyboard artist on Tim Burton's Corpse Bride) and directed by both Butler and Sam Fell (The Tale of Despereaux, Flushed Away).

And if THAT weren't enough, the crew is STACKED with some of the best in the stop-motion/animation biz - Arianne Sutner (animation producer, The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou)
column9: Academy Award winner Brian Van't Hul (King Kong, Coraline)
column10: Emmy winner Nelson Lowry (Fantastic Mr. Fox, Corpse Bride) and Tristan Oliver (Fantastic Mr Fox, Wallace &amp
column11:
Gromit in The Curse of The Were-Rabbit) will be adding their expertise and know-how to make ParaNorman a box office hit.

And now, The Frame Rate:

Considering Coraline, Focus' second-highest grossing movie of all time (earning over $75 million domestic) earned not only numerous Golden Globe, BAFTA, Critics' Choice noms, it was also an Academy Award nom for Best Animated Feature AND named one of that year's 10 Best Films by American Film Institute (AFI)
column12: I have some PRETTY big expectations for ParaNorman, BUT&hellip
column13:
I take comfort in the fact that Focus/LAIKA were smart enough to recognize a good thing and (to paraphrase Jake and Elwood Blues) ""got the band back together"".

&ldquo
column14: Everyone at Focus is proud to be partnered with&nbsp
column16: again on their newest wondrous creations. Travis Knight&nbsp
column17: is both an extraordinary businessman and a visionary artist who we know will shepherd these projects with imagination and originality. We&rsquo
column18: re thrilled to have ParaNorman as our next movie together, one which marries the stunning visuals of 3D stop-motion with a compelling, heartfelt, and funny story anchored by a terrifically relatable underdog hero.&rdquo

column1: (ParaNorman still courtesy of LAIKA)
The Frame Rate: While NOT a fan of live action 3D films, I do love a good animated film, 3D or no. Open eyes, open heart, open mind&hellip

ParaNorman is slated for release August 17, 2012

column1:
Only the second stop-motion animated feature to be made in 3D (Coraline was the first), ParaNorman is billed as a comedic thriller about a small town that becomes overrun with zombies and the only person in town who can speak to the dead is a young, misunderstood lad named Norman. Not only does Norman have to deal with the town's zombie problem, he also has to face ghosts, witches, and (of course) idiot grown-ups in order to save his town from a centuries-old curse and while up to the challenge - Norman finds his abilities stretched to the absolute limit.



With Kodi Smit-McPhee (The Road, Let Me In) as the voice of Norman, the cast includes Oscar nominees and a Broadway LEGEND. With Casey Affleck (Good Will Hunting)
column3: Jeff Garlin (Curb Your Enthusiasm, Toy Story 3)
column8:
Christopher Mintz-Plasse (Superbad, How To Train Your Dragon) and MY personal heroine (known as one of the Grand Dames of Broadway) Elaine Stritch (30 Rock) - this movie shows great promise of being something wonderfully creepy!

Currently in production, ParaNorman is written by Chris Butler (storyboard supervisor for Coraline/storyboard artist on Tim Burton's Corpse Bride) and directed by both Butler and Sam Fell (The Tale of Despereaux, Flushed Away).

And if THAT weren't enough, the crew is STACKED with some of the best in the stop-motion/animation biz - Arianne Sutner (animation producer, The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou)
column9: Academy Award winner Brian Van't Hul (King Kong, Coraline)
column10: Emmy winner Nelson Lowry (Fantastic Mr. Fox, Corpse Bride) and Tristan Oliver (Fantastic Mr Fox, Wallace &amp
column11:
Gromit in The Curse of The Were-Rabbit) will be adding their expertise and know-how to make ParaNorman a box office hit.

And now, The Frame Rate:

Considering Coraline, Focus' second-highest grossing movie of all time (earning over $75 million domestic) earned not only numerous Golden Globe, BAFTA, Critics' Choice noms, it was also an Academy Award nom for Best Animated Feature AND named one of that year's 10 Best Films by American Film Institute (AFI)
column12: I have some PRETTY big expectations for ParaNorman, BUT&hellip
column13:
I take comfort in the fact that Focus/LAIKA were smart enough to recognize a good thing and (to paraphrase Jake and Elwood Blues) ""got the band back together"".

&ldquo
column14: Everyone at Focus is proud to be partnered with&nbsp
column16: again on their newest wondrous creations. Travis Knight&nbsp
column17: is both an extraordinary businessman and a visionary artist who we know will shepherd these projects with imagination and originality. We&rsquo
column18: re thrilled to have ParaNorman as our next movie together, one which marries the stunning visuals of 3D stop-motion with a compelling, heartfelt, and funny story anchored by a terrifically relatable underdog hero.&rdquo

column1: (ParaNorman still courtesy of LAIKA)
The Frame Rate: While NOT a fan of live action 3D films, I do love a good animated film, 3D or no. Open eyes, open heart, open mind&hellip

ParaNorman is slated for release August 17, 2012

166,"0","Pop Film: 9 Absurd Movie Premises That Actually Happened","Pop Film: 9 Absurd Movie Premises That Actually Happened","","",,"

Pop Film: 9 Absurd Movie Premises That Actually Happened
By: Karl Smallwood, Mohammed Shariff, Drew Miller

Even a great movie or TV show isn't above throwing in one ridiculous, larger-than-life character who almost ruins any element of realism in the plot. The genius who's too smart, the hero who's too cool, the rebel who breaks the rules but somehow never gets punished for it.
Hey, you know where else you find ridiculous characters like that? Real life.

We're so used to Sylvester Stallone playing sneering, invincible killing machines that we forget that the whole point of Rocky was that the guy was a vulnerable, everyday schlub who worked odd jobs because he stunk at boxing. Hell, half of you reading this probably only saw the sequels and don't even realize the original Rocky ended with him losing the match.

No, the inspirational -- and laughably unrealistic -- part of the story was that this Philadelphia doofus and part-time boxer somehow got a shot at the flamboyant world champ, knocked him down, then went toe-to-toe for the duration of the fight, taking the best the champ could dish out. At the end, Rocky's face is a swollen, bloody mess, but he hangs tough and for one night proved he could hang with the best.

The real guy's name was Chuck Wepner. In 1975 he was a liquor salesman in New Jersey by day, boxer by night. And he got the same deal as Rocky. A lottery ticket of a fight that, if he won, would make him the champion of the world. It was considered such a big deal at the time that Wepner made the cover of Sports Illustrated, despite the fact that he looked like this:

Remember how by the end of his climactic fights, Rocky's face always looked like an animal you've never seen before had been run over by a truck? And the unrealistic amounts of blood leaping off of Rocky's face in slow motion every time he got punched? Wepner's boxing nickname was ""The Bayonne Bleeder"" because his face would spurt blood pretty much the moment a boxing glove touched it (Wepner had more than 300 stitches in his face -- he was apparently not the most elusive boxer of his era).

Instead of Apollo Creed, Wepner simply had to face one of the best boxers in the history of human civilization - Muhammad Ali. The champ wanted an easy fight as a warm-up to a real match later, so we're guessing he was looking at a list and picking between ""The Bayonne Bleeder"" and a guy named ""Brittle Ribs Ranalli."" Ali and Wepner would split the purse 94% to 6% in Ali's favor.
Just as in Rocky, Ali toyed with Wepner early on and just as in the film, Wepner knocked Ali down, shocking the boxing world.

Ali got up, and spent the rest of the fight using Wepner's face as a speed bag. But just like Rocky, Wepner would not go down. Finally, in the 15th and final round, the refs stopped the fight. Wepner's face looked worse than Rocky's -- he'd need 23 stitches after it was over. But he stayed on his feet.

A young Sylvester Stallone watched that match on TV, and immediately pounded out the screenplay for Rocky, spawning an Academy award-winning film, five sequels and an entire generation of scrappy underdog protagonists in sports movies. Wepner would live on in obscurity, only capturing the public eye when he emerged from retirement years later to fight a Soviet superman and single-handedly end the cold war.

Pop Film: X-Men: First Class Character Trailers

20th Century Fox has released three character trailers for X-Men: First Class, each of which shine a spotlight on one of the many mutant students of Professor Charles Xavier (James McAvoy). First up is Lucas Till as Havok (aka Alex Summers), who can generate plasma blasts capable of mass destruction.
column3: Caleb Landry Jones who stars as Banshee (aka Sean Cassidy), a young man capable of producing a sonic scream that he can wield as a weapon. Third is Nicholas Hoult as Beast (aka Hank McCoy), a super smart young scientist capable of transforming into an unsightly blue powerhouse, and Fourth, Mystique, the shape-shifter played this time by Jennifer Lawrence. Check them all out below.

169,"0","Pop Games: Portal 2 IRL","Pop Games: Portal 2 IRL","","",,"

Pop Games: Portal 2 IRL
by Kate Welch (She Geek Show)

Portal 2 IRL Since the release of Portal 2, there's been a massive surge of creativity in its fans, causing people to make homages to the series under their own steam. (Pun intended.) Valve really does have some of the most devoted fans in the world. Here's a collection of some of the crafty things fans have come up with.

This is a working Portal 2 turret, life-sized, with a functional laser! It also has a motion sensor which triggers all our favorite turretisms. You can see his progress shots in his Flickr album here.
Devotion. I knew it was only a matter of time. (Human canvas's tumblr is here.)

3D printed turrets! What is a 3D printer? Where can I get one?! I need to print all kinds of objects. Including, but not limited to, an ice cream sandwich and a Portal 2 turret. (via. A turret egg cup. So simple, and yet, so creative. (How-to instructions here.)
Portal bookends! These might be my favorite. The Etsy shop where they're being sold has a waiting list, but they're still making them.
Lovingly (and, I'm guessing, patiently) crafted P-body and Atlas. Medium: Lego. Artist: unknown. Another great artist goes unappreciated in his/her time. (via.)

Yet another turret that talks and has laser-like emissions, but this time, IT'S SUPER CUDDLY. I'll stop there. There are plenty more Portal 2 crafts and arts coming every day. You know a game has some kind of special sauce when it inspires this kind of real life devotion. Nice job, Valve.
Check out the latest episode of the She Geek Show:

column2: feature=channel_video_title"">She Geek Show: One Week Till LA Noire!

<li><span>Mystique has one of the coolest powers, a shape-shifter, which means she can assume the form of other humans. This also includes clothing and the ability to mimic anybody&rsquo
• Due to her shape-shifting powers, she can also heal fast and can form a resistance to poisons.

• In the first 3 X-Men movie she was played by Rebecca Romijn.
• Jennifer Lawrence will play the role in X-Men First Class.
• In X-Men First Class, Mystique will not be an X-Man and not a villain. This movie will set up her switch to villainy.
• A departure from the comic book history, Mystique might be starting a romance with Beast. With both of them having blue skin, it seems like that is a good ice breaker.

column1: 174,"0","The Frame Rate: Game of Thrones: Genesis","The Frame Rate: Game of Thrones: Genesis","","",,"<!-- p.p1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px

The Frame Rate: Game of Thrones: Genesis
by
Coming soon to a PC near you!
Thanks to the ever growing popularity of the HBO series ""Game of Thrones"",
column2: this morning, Cyanide Studio (makers of Blood Bowl) announced they will be releasing their new RTS title, ""A Game of Thrones: Genesis"" for the PC.&nbsp

column1: Based on the George R.R. Martin series of books, ""A Song of Ice and Fire"", GOT: Genesis promises to challenge your political, strategic, and military skills as you make your way through the Seven Kingdoms.
Storm's End seat of House Baratheon

Players will find themselves right in the eye of the storm as they traverse the battles, intrigues, and 1000 years of origins and history between the Houses in the Kingdom of Westeros as told by the novels. From Nymeria's arrival to the Kingdom of Dorne to the ""Others"" beyond The Wall, players take part in the founding events and largest battles (such as Aegon the Conqueror's invasion of the continent or the War of the Usurper) that has shaped Westeros'
column2: current fate as we know it.&nbsp

column1: The Eyrie house of the Arryns
Vale of Arryn with the Eyrie in background
Dorne, land of sun and sand
Cyanide Studio is also quick to note that in this RTS (or real-time strategy), victory isn't always the result of brute force.
column2: There is something to be said for victories that result from choosing to take either a military approach, crippling their economic livelihood or using good ol' fashioned political tactics and dirty deals to crush your enemy.&nbsp

column1: Written under the supervision of George R.R. Martin himself, both the single and multiplayer campaigns promise to be great fun.
column2: In MP, you and 7 others may find yourselves involved in alliances, betrayals, and of course, BATTLES - all in a race to see who can plant their butt in the Iron Throne first!&nbsp

column1: Beware the fury of the Targaryen!
A Game of Thrones: Genesis is set for release sometime this summer. PC darlings, rejoice!
For more information, hit up GoT: Genesis' official website

The Frame Rate: Smells AWESOME and hopefully a fitting companion to the novels and HBO series. #CrixApproved

","

178,"0","The Office: Boss Battle! ","The Office: Boss Battle! ","","",,"

The Office: Boss Battle!

column2: tonight is the season finale of The Office and we've seen some interesting things go on this season that culminated in: the departure of Michael Scott (sob! cry! QQ!), the temporary reign of DeAngelo Vickers (who was then hoisted by his own petard, so to speak), Jim turning down the position of Interim Manager only to see Dwight being put in charge&hellip
column3: until he discharges a firearm in the office, nearly injuring Andy and shifts the power BACK to the staff, forcing Dwight to show his hand to Jo when she comes to town and *DEEP BREATH*&hellip
column4: forces her to relieve Dwight of his duties (NOT FIRED, just no longer in charge) and begin a search for a new manager.

column1: And that's where we find ourselves tonight.

Jo recruits an interoffice search committee (comprised of Jim, Gabe, and Toby) to find the new branch manager and boy, do they have some interesting candidates that include Will Arnett, Jim Carrey, Warren Buffett (yes, THAT Warren Buffett), James Spader, Ray Romano, Ricky Gervais, AND&hellip
Here's MY reasonings as to why you won't be seeing most of them drinking out of their OWN ""World's Best Boss"" mug at Dunder-Mifflin
First off, let's just eliminate any possible interoffice candidates.

Andy (Ed Helms) - cracks under pressure and by his OWN admission is a TERRIBLE salesman, not to mention he nearly brought down the company with the whistle-blowing of the combustible copiers last season.
Kelly (Mindy Kaling) - What, are you kidding me?
column2: If Kelly took over, the office would look like Hello Kitty exploded all over it and the branch would most likely fold in less than 6 months as I suspect Ryan (BJ Novak) would fleece the company retirement fund and leave her holding the bag.&nbsp
Darryl has GREAT company ideas but I think the idea of running the company would be cool to him in name only to impress his daughter.&nbsp
column3: T'would be fun to see Darryl mess with Dwight, though. &nbsp

column1: Danny Courdray (Timothy Olyphant) - Devastatingly charming and ridiculously good looking, Courdray is excellent at his job and EVENTUALLY Michael liked him but because of that tension that was built with the viewers, doubtful that he will be considered.
Will Arnett - Considering we've seen him play two different types of bumbling company men in TWO different shows, I gotta say ""Nope, nope, nope.""
column2: In Arrested Development, he was Gob Bluth -&nbsp
column3: an amateur magician with even more amateur ideas to run the company
column4: and in ""The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret"", he was basically Gob on steroids with a string of f-bombs attached.&nbsp
column5: No matter what he does, Arnett will always be viewed as Gob Bluth and that will indeed carry over to The Office (just like Will Ferrell was basically his character from Step Brothers with a soup&ccedil

column1: (That, and Arnett's new pilot, Up All Night, was just picked up by NBC. So that's him, sorted.)
Jim Carrey - Sorry, Jim. I just don't see it.
column2: You're a brilliant character, comedic, and dramatic actor (trust me, I have been in near fistfights over defending your character in The Cable Guy) and have GREAT timing, but it's only a matter of time where you're gonna need time off to make a movie and this show needs someone who wants to be planted for a little while.&nbsp
column3: That and the accent you're using in the commercials bugs absolute shiz outta me.&nbsp

column1: Warren Buffett - C'mon people. This is the (new) Cookie Monster equivalent of putting Giuliani on SNL - good as a sometimes food and purely for ratings.

Ray Romano - Not gonna lie, I read his book ""Everything and a Kite"" and enjoyed it immensely. Romano is a great comedian and a great comedic actor but after nine seasons of Everybody Loves Raymond, CAN Romano pull off a show without a live studio audience telling him what is and isn't working?

Ricky Gervais - He's already had a go and I'm sure he looks at David Brent these days as a ""sometimes food"" as well. As someone who was a fan of the U.K. version, I would see Brent's arrival as a way to tell viewers this is the last season - which would cause people to check out early. And I hear Gervais is booked up for the next year or so as well, so he's out.
It's kind of weird to speculate on a race where EVERY horse is the dark horse, but here's who I think we'll be looking at as Carell's possible successor.

column2: Of all the men, Spader is my top choice.&nbsp
column3: As far as a boss with Michael Scott/Dunder Mifflin type qualities, he's the one and if you were a fan of Boston Legal
column4: you know it, too. Much like Michael Scott, Alan Shore became a formidable opponent when push came to shove and a likable guy&hellip
column6: Spader also has an amazing way of bringing out the best of whoever acts opposite him in a scene, which is why Alan Crane and Denny Crane's (William Shatner) friendship on Boston Legal is in my Top 10 ""Bromances"".&nbsp
column7: If he joins Dunder Mifflin, could prove for some interesting scenes between himself, Jim and Dwight. &nbsp

column2: the last hour or so of sleep before waking, I start to figure out which direction I want my Frame Rate story to go in and found myself asking ""There's loads of males on that list, could they not find a female that could go toe to toe with these comedic heavyweights?"" and that's when I remembered that SHE was the one.

column1: Fans of BBC America will recognize Tate from her role as Donna Noble in Doctor Who (Series 4) and as the writer/star of The Catherine Tate Show, which had a 22 episode run from 2004-2006.
column2: In TCTS, Tate plays multiple characters, both male and female) including a foul mouthed grandmother named Nan
column4: a bratty teen named Lauren whose sole answer to anything is ""Am I bovvered (bothered)?"" or ""Look at my face, is my face bovvered?"". &nbsp

column1: But the one character in Tate's arsenal that immediately popped into my head when I remembered she was guesting on The Office was Ally.

According to the wiki (and because I couldn't have said it better myself), Ally is described as ""a tactless woman with good intentions who unfortunately is a perfect example of someone with foot-in-mouth syndrome. Unwittingly she offends all that she comes into contact with at parties, and then in an attempt to dig herself out of the ditch she has created, only worsens the situation.""
My favorite thing about Ally is when she's so far into that hole, she does this weird sing-song squeal that sounds like ""AHHHHHHHHH!"" as she races out of the room.
Watch these clips and TELL me she's not Michael Scott with breasts.
Warning: slightly NSFW for profanity (very little, but still) so I suggest headphones.
So why her? Why do I think she's the one?
As weird as this is about to sound, it's because she is not a highly recognized name in the U.S. and I think that's her main advantage.
column2: Because of the popularity and iconic roles that the other men have built their careers on and will be associated with them for the rest of their lives, it can prove difficult when taking on a similar type role in ANYthing else.&nbsp
column3: You can't help but compare them and then wonder if they really are the right fit. &nbsp

column1: Think the British version of Kristen Wiig and you have Catherine Tate. BOOM.

Tate is hilarious and extremely likable but can also raise that ""awkward moment/damage control save"" factor at the drop of a dime, a quality that is needed for a show like The Office. And if they cast her, they could get the Doctor Who fanbase as well, which could provide good numbers because next season could be viewed as a ""rebuilding year"".
column2: Luckily for them, they've got a couple months to figure it out, I just hope they make the right choice.&nbsp

column1: That SAID, tonight's finale should prove interesting,
column2: filled with awkward moments and awkward laughs - I'm so ready! &nbsp

column1: The Frame Rate: BOSS BATTLE BEGINS IN 3&hellip

***What about you? Who do YOU think'll be bringing their own ""World's Best Boss"" mug to work next season? I'm genuinely curious to hear what you think, so tell me your thoughts below!

","
